abstract: Some legal scholars are weighing whether case could be made for curbing freedom of speech on Internet in light of Islamic State's success in grooming terrorists online; First Amendment protects free speech unless it presents 'clear and present danger,' line that is increasingly murky in modern Internet era.
lead_paragraph: Some legal scholars are asking whether it is time to reconsider the “clear and present danger” standard for curbing the freedom of speech.

headline.main: ISIS Influence on Web Prompts Second Thoughts on First Amendment
headline.print_headline: ISIS Incitement on Internet Raises Second Thoughts About First Amendment

snippet: Some legal scholars are asking whether it is time to reconsider the “clear and present danger” standard for curbing the freedom of speech.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
